meanings.definition: To officially recognize or approve again, especially after a period of evaluation or review.
meanings.sent1: The school was reaccredited after meeting all the standards.
meanings.sent2: The hospital was reaccredited for providing excellent patient care.
meanings.sent3: The zoo was reaccredited, ensuring the animals were happy and healthy.
meanings.sent4: The town was reaccredited, shining brightly in the eyes of the state.
meanings.sent5: The museum was reaccredited, its dedication to preserving history evident to all.

meanings.definition: To grant official recognition or approval again, typically for a specific period of time.
meanings.sent1: The organization reaccredited the volunteers for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: The agency reaccredited the program for another five years.
meanings.sent3: The club reaccredited its members, ensuring their commitment to the cause.
meanings.sent4: The company reaccredited the training course, ensuring quality education.
meanings.sent5: The committee reaccredited the event, guaranteeing its success for the future.
